DataElement.preferredName: Donor Cellular Infusion Other Indication Diagnosis Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the indication for the donor cellular infusion.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A form of adoptive immunotherapy used after hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT). Lymphocytes from the original stem cell donor are given to the HSCT recipient, after the transplant, to augment an antitumor immune response (graft-versus-tumor), or ensure that the donor stem cells remain engrafted. Although lymphocytes are the most commonly used cell, other cells including fibroblasts, mesenchymal or dendritic cells may be delivered to affect chimerism, treat Graft vs. Host Disease, treat viral infections or Post Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disease or other novel uses under investigation._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned. (NCI)._A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A form of adoptive immunotherapy used after hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT). Lymphocytes from the original stem cell donor are given to the HSCT recipient, after the transplant, to augment an antitumor immune response (graft-versus-tumor), or ensure that the donor stem cells remain engrafted. Although lymphocytes are the most commonly used cell, other cells including fibroblasts, mesenchymal or dendritic cells may be delivered to affect chimerism, treat Graft vs. Host Disease, treat viral infections or Post Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disease or other novel uses under investigation.

Concepts.definition: A form of adoptive immunotherapy used after hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT). Lymphocytes from the original stem cell donor are given to the HSCT recipient, after the transplant, to augment an antitumor immune response (graft-versus-tumor), or ensure that the donor stem cells remain engrafted. Although lymphocytes are the most commonly used cell, other cells including fibroblasts, mesenchymal or dendritic cells may be delivered to affect chimerism, treat Graft vs. Host Disease, treat viral infections or Post Transplant Lymphoproliferative Disease or other novel uses under investigation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication).

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

A sign, signal, circumstance, or symptom which serves to indicate or point out the cause, pathology, treatment, or issue of an attack of disease; the basis for initiation of a treatment for a disease or of a diagnostic test (causal, or symptomatic, or disease-specific indication).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the specified free-text field related to an aspect of patient/participant's diagnosis

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.
